channel.title: Im upgradin
channel.description:
AMD Phenom II X4 945 3.0ghz Gigabyte MA790XT-UD4P Galaxy GTX260+ 216 sp 500gb samsung sata II 500gb WD external 30gb OCZ vertex turbo SSD 4GB G.Skill DDR3 1333mhz Acer 23" LCD (forgot model)
SteelSeries Siberia V2 headphones Logitech G51 speakers Razer DeathAdder mouse Razer Mantis (Control) mousepad Logitech G15
^ my current rig.
got 1k to beef up that rig, i think another 23" monitor, new case, new PSU and 5870 gcard, another 4gb ram, a 1tb hdd, some neons for case and a water coolin kit.
wat u guys think

item.title: Im upgradin
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Neon is retarded gtfo

Read full topic

item.title: Im upgradin
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:10, topic:336881”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=433296.msg3181825#msg3181825 date=1271376818]
watercooling, the extra 4gb of ram, and another 23" monitor are unnecessary

get a core i7

if your current psu is fine, then dont change that either

maybe sell your old parts for some extra $$?

[/quote]

that would be stupid to upgrade my mobo, ram and CPU to i7 for a small benefit, my current CPU is still great.[/quote]

Exactally, the only reason to go for a i7 is if your building new. Video cards are really the only thing that need updated every often, though I could be getting 200FPS in some games 40FPS is far good enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Im upgradin
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I know seriously 6 months ago I could build a budget gaming PC for around 500 bucks with a video card that worked very well. Now I can barely get motherboard case cpu and 4gb of ram without hitting 350. Add harddrive, decent psu, and video card and your up to 700.

Read full topic

item.title: Im upgradin
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

thing is, my case is really bad, took the neons out, its dusty as hell, case is half broken and my SSD just sits ontop of my normal HDD without even being screwed in (probably smacks against the sides when i move it all the time)

definitely need a new sexy case and PSU, and will do neat cables then ill get pix

Read full topic
